paper_title.ja: 下顎枝歯L字型骨切りと矢状分割術後のオトガイ神経知覚異常について
paper_title.en: Mental nerve sensory deficits after intraoral inverted L ramus and sagittal splitting ramus osteotomy

description.ja: Neurosensory function in the mental nerve region of 24 patients who had undergone intraoral inverted L ramus and sagittal splitting ramus osteotomy was assessed by evaluating light touch perception. Neuropathy was present in 67% of the 48 mental nerves examined. The incidence and recovery period of neuropathy on the side undergoing inverted L ramus osteotomy were similar to those on the side undergoing sagittal splitting ramus osteotomy. Our results suggest that dissection of the periosteum around the mandibular foramen might be a main cause of neurosensory deficits of the mental nerve after mandibular osteotomy.
description.en: Neurosensory function in the mental nerve region of 24 patients who had undergone intraoral inverted L ramus and sagittal splitting ramus osteotomy was assessed by evaluating light touch perception. Neuropathy was present in 67% of the 48 mental nerves examined. The incidence and recovery period of neuropathy on the side undergoing inverted L ramus osteotomy were similar to those on the side undergoing sagittal splitting ramus osteotomy. Our results suggest that dissection of the periosteum around the mandibular foramen might be a main cause of neurosensory deficits of the mental nerve after mandibular osteotomy.

paper_title.en: Anti-fibrin antibody binding in valvular vegetations and kidney lesions during experimental endocarditis

description.en: In Streptococcus sanguinis (sauguis) induced experimental endocarditis, we sought evidence that the development of aortic valvular vegetation depends on the availability of fibrin. Endocarditis was induced in New Zealand white rabbits by catheter placement into the left ventricle and inoculation of the bacteria. Fibrin was localized in the developing vegetation with (99m)Technetium (Tc)-labeled anti-fibrin antibody one or three days later. When rabbit anti-fibrin antibody was given intravenously on day 1, the mass of aortic valvular vegetation was significantly reduced at day 3; infusion of non-specific rabbit IgG showed no effect. The Tc-99m-labeled anti-fibrin antibody also labeled kidneys that showed macroscopic subcapsular hemorrhage. To learn if the deposition of fibrin in the kidneys was a consequence of endocarditis required a comparison of farm-bred and specific pathogen-free rabbits before and after the induction of endocarditis. Before induction, the kidneys of farm-bred rabbits were labeled, but specific pathogen-free rabbits were free of labeling and signs of macroscopic hemorrhage. After 3 days of endocarditis, kidneys of 10 of 14 specific pathogen-free rabbits labeled with Tc-99m-labeled anti-fibrin antibody and showed hemorrhage. Kidney lesions were suggested to be a frequent sequellae of S. sanguinis infective endocarditis. For the first three, fibrin was shown to be required for the continued development of aortic valvular vegetations.

paper_title.en: Anti-fibrin antibody binding in valvular vegetations and kidney lesions during experimental endocarditis

description.en: In Streptococcus sanguinis (sauguis) induced experimental endocarditis, we sought evidence that the development of aortic valvular vegetation depends on the availability of fibrin. Endocarditis was induced in New Zealand white rabbits by catheter placement into the left ventricle and inoculation of the bacteria. Fibrin was localized in the developing vegetation with (99m)Technetium (Tc)-labeled anti-fibrin antibody one or three days later. When rabbit anti-fibrin antibody was given intravenously on day 1, the mass of aortic valvular vegetation was significantly reduced at day 3; infusion of non-specific rabbit IgG showed no effect. The Tc-99m-labeled anti-fibrin antibody also labeled kidneys that showed macroscopic subcapsular hemorrhage. To learn if the deposition of fibrin in the kidneys was a consequence of endocarditis required a comparison of farm-bred and specific pathogen-free rabbits before and after the induction of endocarditis. Before induction, the kidneys of farm-bred rabbits were labeled, but specific pathogen-free rabbits were free of labeling and signs of macroscopic hemorrhage. After 3 days of endocarditis, kidneys of 10 of 14 specific pathogen-free rabbits labeled with Tc-99m-labeled anti-fibrin antibody and showed hemorrhage. Kidney lesions were suggested to be a frequent sequellae of S. sanguinis infective endocarditis. For the first three, fibrin was shown to be required for the continued development of aortic valvular vegetations.

paper_title.ja: 口腔癌に対する Leucovorin 併用化学放射線療法の術前治療効果
paper_title.en: Preoperative effect due to radio-and chemotherapy with leucovorin for oral cancer

description.ja: 口腔癌の治療に,cisplatin,5-fluorouracil,Leucovorinを用いたPFL複合化学療法と放射線療法を併用し,術前の治療効果と副作用について検討した.対象は,2年間に治療した口腔領域癌一次症例47例のうち,進展例でクレアチニン・クリアランスが70ml/min以上の比較的全身状態が良好な7例(男性5例,女性2例,52歳〜68歳)である.その結果,臨床的治療効果の奏効率は71.4%,組織学的治療効果は100%であった.致命的な副作用はみられなかったが,口内炎が全例にみられた.また,軽度の骨髄抑制が6例にみられたが,手術直前には全てgrade 0の範囲に回復した.なお,7例は全て術後5年以上を経過し,無病生存中である.PFL療法は有用な癌化学療法であるが,口内炎を増強させるので,抗癌剤投与のタイム・スケジュールや投与量などを慎重に計画する必要がある

paper_title.en: Postoperative stability in mandibular asymmetry cases corrected by combination with inverted L ramus osteotomy : Comparison with bilateral sagittal splitting ramus osteotomy

description.ja: 下顎非対称を伴った顎変形症に対し,非回転側にILROを,回転側にSSROを用いた顎矯正手術を施行した後の,術後安定性について正面及び側面頭部X線規格写真を用いて検討した.I-S法は両側SSRO例と同様,十分な術後安定性を有していた

paper_title.ja: 上顎骨に生じた放線菌症の1例(共著)
paper_title.en: A case of actinomycosis arising in the maxilla

description.ja:
Recently, actinomycosis has become a relatively rare bacterial infection, which is difficult to diagnose when clinical symptoms are not typical. We report a rare case of actinomycosis arising in the maxilla that showed atypical symptoms and was suspected to be a benign tumor or osteomyelitis.
The patient was a 53-year-old man referred for examination of a lesion in the left side of the maxilla. Intraoral examination showed a diffuse swelling and a purulent fistula in the left side of the maxillary premolar region. Computed tomography revealed an irregular radiolucent mass with small nodular components similar in density to bone. An odontogenic tumor or osteomyelitis was suspected. The clinical diagnosis was a benign tumor, and the lesion was enucleated by an intraoral approach with the patient under general anesthesia. The histopathological diagnosis was actinomycosis.
description.en:
Recently, actinomycosis has become a relatively rare bacterial infection, which is difficult to diagnose when clinical symptoms are not typical. We report a rare case of actinomycosis arising in the maxilla that showed atypical symptoms and was suspected to be a benign tumor or osteomyelitis.
The patient was a 53-year-old man referred for examination of a lesion in the left side of the maxilla. Intraoral examination showed a diffuse swelling and a purulent fistula in the left side of the maxillary premolar region. Computed tomography revealed an irregular radiolucent mass with small nodular components similar in density to bone. An odontogenic tumor or osteomyelitis was suspected. The clinical diagnosis was a benign tumor, and the lesion was enucleated by an intraoral approach with the patient under general anesthesia. The histopathological diagnosis was actinomycosis.
